patterns: Give me a short description on classification
responses: Grouping animals into different levels based on their common characteristics is known as classification

patterns: what are the significance of classification
Give me a short description on the signifance of classification
responses: Grouping animals into different levels based on their common characteristics is known as classification

patterns: Give me a short description on Displacement
responses: Describes how far an object moves from its initial position. It includes both magnitude and direction.

patterns: Give me a short description on Final Velocity
responses: The speed of an object at the end of a time interval, factoring in initial velocity and acceleration.

patterns: Give me a short description on Velocity
responses: The rate at which an object changes its position, a vector quantity with both speed and direction.

patterns: Give me a short description on Acceleration
responses: The rate at which an object’s velocity changes over time.

patterns: what are the Newton’s 2nd Law of Motion
what is Newton’s 2nd Law of Motion
Give me a short description on Newton’s 2nd Law of Motion
responses: The force needed to accelerate an object is proportional to its mass and acceleration.

patterns: Give me a short description on Force
responses: A push or pull on an object that causes it to accelerate.

patterns: Give me a short description on Weight
responses: The force of gravity acting on an object’s mass.

patterns: Give me a short description on Momentum
responses: The product of an object's mass and velocity, representing how much motion it has.

patterns: Give me a short description on Impulse
responses: The change in momentum of an object when a force is applied over time.

patterns: Give me a short description on Work
responses: The energy transferred when a force moves an object over a distance.

patterns: Give me a short description on Kinetic Energy
responses: The energy an object possesses due to its motion.

patterns: Give me a short description on Potential Energy
responses: The energy stored in an object due to its position (like height in a gravitational field).

patterns: Give me a short description on Mechanical Energy
responses: The total energy (kinetic + potential) an object has.

patterns: Give me a short description on Power
responses: The rate at which work is done or energy is transferred.

patterns: Give me a short description on Gravitational Force
responses: The attractive force between two masses.

patterns: what are the Gravitational Potential Energy
Give me a short description on Force
responses: The energy an object has due to its position in a gravitational field.

patterns: what are the Acceleration due to Gravity
what is Acceleration due to Gravity
Give me a short description on Acceleration due to Gravity
responses: The rate of acceleration for an object in free fall near Earth’s surface.

patterns: Give me a short description on Centripetal Force
responses: A push or pull on an object that causes it to accelerate.

patterns: Give me a short description on Angular Velocity
responses: The rate at which an object rotates around a point or axis.

patterns: Give me a short description on Tangential Velocity
responses: The speed of an object moving along a circular path at a particular radius.

patterns: Give me a short description on Displacement
responses: The distance of an oscillating object from its equilibrium position.

patterns: Give me a short description on Force
responses: The time taken for one complete oscillation or cycle.

patterns: Give me a short description on Potential Energy
responses: Energy stored in the system at maximum displacement in simple harmonic motion.

patterns: what are the First Law of Thermodynamics
what is First Law of Thermodynamics
Give me a short description on First Law of Thermodynamics
responses: Energy in a system is conserved; it can change forms but not be created or destroyed.

patterns: what are the Ideal Gas Law
Give me a short description on Ideal Gas Law
responses: Describes the behavior of an ideal gas in terms of pressure, volume, and temperature.

patterns: Give me a short description on Heat
responses: Energy transferred between objects due to a temperature difference.

patterns: what are the Work Done by a Gas
what is Work Done by a Gas
Give me a short description on Work Done by a Gas
responses: The work performed by a gas when it expands or compresses.

patterns: Give me a short description on Force
responses: Describes the electric force between two charged objects.

patterns: Give me a short description on Coulomb’s Law
responses: The force per unit charge exerted by a charged object.

patterns: what are the Electric Potential Energy
Give me a short description on Electric Potential Energy
responses: The energy a charge has due to its position in an electric field.

patterns: Give me a short description on Capacitance
responses: The ability of a system to store electric charge per unit voltage.

patterns: Give me a short description on Ohm’s Law
responses: The relationship between voltage, current, and resistance in an electrical circuit.

patterns: Give me a short description on Power
responses: The rate at which electrical energy is used or generated.

patterns: Give me a short description on Wave Speed
responses: The speed at which a wave propagates through a medium.

patterns: Give me a short description on Frequency
responses: The number of complete wave cycles that pass a point in a given time period.

patterns: Give me a short description on Doppler Effect
responses: The change in frequency or wavelength of a wave as observed by someone moving relative to the wave source.

patterns: Give me a short description on Snell's Law
responses: Describes how light bends when passing between two materials with different refractive indices.

patterns: Give me a short description on Lens Formula
responses: Relates the focal length of a lens to the object distance and the image distance.

patterns: Give me a short description on Magnification
responses: The ratio of the image height to the object height, describing how much an image is enlarged.

patterns: Give me a short description on Magnification
responses: The ratio of the image height to the object height, describing how much an image is enlarged.

patterns: what are the Einstein’s Mass-Energy Relation
Give me a short description on Einstein’s Mass-Energy Relation
responses: Describes how mass can be converted into energy and vice versa.

patterns: Give me a short description on Photoelectric Effect
,responses: The emission of electrons from a material when it absorbs light energy.

patterns: what are the De Broglie Wavelength
Give me a short description on De Broglie Wavelength
responses: The wavelength associated with a particle due to its momentum, central to quantum mechanics.
“Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.”

“I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best.”
“Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.”
“So many books, so little time.”
“A room without books is like a body without a soul.”
“Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind.”
“You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching,Love like you'll never be hurt,Sing like there's nobody listening,And live like it's heaven on earth.”
“You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams.”
“You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.”
“Be the change that you wish to see in the world.”
“In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.”
“If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals.”
“Donâ€™t walk in front of meâ€¦ I may not followDonâ€™t walk behind meâ€¦ I may not leadWalk beside meâ€¦ just be my friend”
“If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.”
“Friendship ... is born at the moment when one man says to another "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .”
“A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you.”
“Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.”
“To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.”
“Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.”
“Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that.”
“Without music, life would be a mistake.”
“We accept the love we think we deserve.”
“I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying.”
“To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.”

“Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do.”
“Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results.”
“Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results.”

“I believe that everything happens for a reason. People change so that you can learn to let go, things go wrong so that you appreciate them when they're right, you believe lies so you eventually learn to trust no one but yourself, and sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together.”

“Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover.”
“It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not.”

“All that is gold does not glitter,Not all those who wander are lost;The old that is strong does not wither,Deep roots are not reached by the frost.From the ashes a fire shall be woken,A light from the shadows shall spring;Renewed shall be blade that was broken,The crownless again shall be king.”
“It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.”
“The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid.”
“Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.”
“There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.”
“It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.”
“Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life.”
“As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once.”
“We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.”
“Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten.”
“It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it.”
“The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.”
“Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform (or pause and reflect).”
“Life is what happens to us while we are making other plans.”
“Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift of God, which is why we call it the present.”
“I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.”
“It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.”

“The opposite of love is not hate, it's indifference. The opposite of art is not ugliness, it's indifference. The opposite of faith is not heresy, it's indifference. And the opposite of life is not death, it's indifference.”
“A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water.”
“The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read.”
